9ed1932e-3a5a-4539-a0c9-4ec9875f17e3.description: This badge is awarded to students who successfully complete a Smart Start with the AAC. Students who earn this badge will have a greater awareness of campus resources and skills that can help them find success in their collegiate journey.
9ed1932e-3a5a-4539-a0c9-4ec9875f17e3.name: AAC Smart Start

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must successfully complete a Smart Start through the AAC, either in person or online via Canvas.

skills.name: Knowledge Of Services Offered At AAC

70e67140-376e-4e7f-8498-9671670960d6.description: An earner is recognized for a major achievement or effort on a specific project which positively impacts the college, department, or community. The earner is an hourly employee who has gone “above the norm” of the job responsibilities to include: accomplishing a special project; assuming additional responsibilities; implementing excellent systems for accomplishing work in a department; providing special service to another department; & an outstanding contributor to the success of the college.
70e67140-376e-4e7f-8498-9671670960d6.name: Staff VIP

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: An earner must be nominated by supervisor or with their supervisor's support.

Be reviewed by a committee of their peers based on predetermined criteria. Criteria includes: above and beyond scope of normal job duties; potential impact; innovation/entreprenuership; & leadership influenced.

ef7f6f86-3fda-4911-ba1a-e0a5184e296f.description: The earner of this badge has completed training to become a more effective leader in the community college organization. They are able to identify and utilize resources to effectively improve the employee experience and drive business results. The earner is well aware of a variety of leadership strategies and models to lead their team and others.
ef7f6f86-3fda-4911-ba1a-e0a5184e296f.name: Living as a Leader

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following courses: The Seven Most Common Mistakes Leaders Make; Be a Great Coach; Communicate by Design; Understand Your Leadership Style; Create a Culture of Employee Engagement; Maximize Performance 365 Days a Year; Support Yourself & Others Through Change; Resolving Workplace Conflict; Create Productive Meetings; Solve Problems, Make Sound Decisions; Focus Your Team; and Lead by Design.
Participate in 11 one-hour small group coaching sessions monthly with your assigned coach.

8ceb3dbf-ec8b-4f26-abda-bfd09bd00f0c.description: The Distinguished Service award is intended to provide a systematic means for recognizing and rewarding excellence in job performance for all full-time faculty who have complete five years of full-time experience at Johnson County Community College. Earners receive a $5000 cash award.
8ceb3dbf-ec8b-4f26-abda-bfd09bd00f0c.name: Distinguished Service Award

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Earners self-nominate by submitting a teaching portfolio.

Earners must submit a portfolio which includes: Distinguished Service Form Completed and signed by the applicant and Dean; a personal Statement not to exceed five pages, summarizing the applicant's activities and accomplishments during the past two years with all comments addressing the award criteria; supporting documents that address the two academic years prior to the semester of application.

Earners will be assessed by an external judge selected by the Faculty Association president.  Criteria include:  Performance of Job Responsibilities, Divisional and Institutional Responsibilities, Community Engagement, and Professional Development.

e7bd9f4b-2ca8-4192-bfc0-3878373e45b6.description: An earner of this is recognized for making an outstanding effort or major achievement on a specific project which positively impacts the college, department, or community. The earner has gone “above the norm” of the job responsibilities to include: accomplishing a special project; chairing a successful task force; implementing excellent systems for accomplishing work in a department; providing special service to another department; being an outstanding contributor to the success of the college.
e7bd9f4b-2ca8-4192-bfc0-3878373e45b6.name: Spotlight Award

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: An earner must be nominated by supervisor or with their supervisor's support.

Be reviewed by a committee of prior recipients based on predetermined criteria. Criteria includes customer focus; potential impact; innovation/entreprenuership; above and beyond scope of normal job duties; & collaboration/community.

ba505ea0-a789-4856-a7a5-2d42fb1743c4.description: The League of Innovation in the Community College annually recognizes staff members from each of its member colleges who have designed and implemented a significant innovation during the past year. The earner is regarded as a highly influential innovator and is capable of solving problems through creative processes and design thinking.
ba505ea0-a789-4856-a7a5-2d42fb1743c4.name: Innovation of the Year Award

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Be nominated by a colleague as an innovator.
Attach a one-page description of the innovative project or activity. Attach any supporting materials relevant to the project for documentation purposes.
Be reviewed by a committee of prior recipients based on predetermined criteria. Criteria includes quality, efficiency, cost effectiveness, replication, creativity, and timeliness.

a15aebfa-3cfd-46f6-a531-15dd370722e4.description: The student has developed a basic understanding of the cardiovascular and respiratory systems, discussed medical and environmental emergencies as they might relate to CPR, and gained insight into the structure and function of the emergency medical services system. They have demonstrated the most current practical CPR skills, including CPR and airway obstruction techniques on adults, children, and infants. They have also been introduced to the automated external defibrillator (AED).
a15aebfa-3cfd-46f6-a531-15dd370722e4.name: Basic Life Support (CPR) for Healthcare Providers

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Upon successful completion of all American Heart Association standards, the student will receive affirmation at the Basic Rescuer level (Healthcare Provider).

a50664af-a1b7-4fe8-b4be-225dab4d497f.description: The earner of this badge has completed a 3 hour professional development workshop. After completing the workshop the earner will have developed skills with backwards design, writing and aligning learning objectives, utilizing effective test strategies, improving accessibility and item writing.
a50664af-a1b7-4fe8-b4be-225dab4d497f.name: Level 1 Assessment Skills In Biology

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: After participating in the workshop, participants will be able to do the following: Utilize learning outcomes to map and create a fair test. Identify and discuss the process of writing selected response questions to assess learning outcomes. Utilize an evaluation checklist to improve assessment items. Evaluate test performance to determine the quality of test items and overall test to ensure effectiveness and fairness.

ae526ab7-aaa6-47ca-b6f0-d05122505376.description: Earners of this award are recognized for excellence in teaching. This award is made possible by a special endowment from the BNSF Railway. Each instructional division selects nominees. A distinguished educator selects the top recipients from the nominees. Earners receive a $1000 cash award.
ae526ab7-aaa6-47ca-b6f0-d05122505376.name: BNSF Railway Faculty Award

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Earner must be nominated by their instructional division. Divisional nominations will be sent to the Vice President of Academic Affairs/CAO for review and endorsement.

Earner must submit a teaching portfolio with letter of nomination by the division administrator or nominee’s supervisor, a current resume, a personal statement of no more than three pages, a copy of the nominee’s job description, supporting documents (no more than 10 separate documents, with a combined total of no more than 30 pages).

Earners will be assessed by an external judge selected by the college president.  Criteria include:  Excellence in Leadership, Exemplary Performance of Job Responsibilities, and Quality of Service department division, college, and community.

7c686d13-e2c8-4118-b4ea-1a40f2e2044d.description: This award recognizes external publication of outstanding material by JCCC employees, particularly those relating to the improvement of teaching and learning. The earner is recognized for their continued research and publication which increases the college’s national visibility and reputation for excellence.
7c686d13-e2c8-4118-b4ea-1a40f2e2044d.name: Publication Award

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must publish a scholarly article, textbook, popular non-fiction article or book, ore creative work (short stories, poetry, plays & novels) in the past calendar year.
Earners must complete an application and submit a copy of the publication with the application.

Be reviewed by a committee of prior recipients based on predetermined criteria. Criteria includes quality of scholarly, pedagogical, or literary merit and contributes to the broader field of academia.

69700574-87b5-4e2f-8f93-273f81c9983c.description: The student has trained for a career as an operator of assisted living facilities, residential health care facilities, home plus and adult day care facilities with information on the principles of assisted living. They have learned about the aging process and its effect on activities, treatment and management of the elderly, resident rights, state and federal regulations, and issues involved in the management of internal support staff, budgeting, supplies, and outside resources.
69700574-87b5-4e2f-8f93-273f81c9983c.name: Kansas Assisted Living Facility Operator Training Course

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Participants who attend all sessions and successfully complete a comprehensive examination will meet the requirements to be a long-term care facility "Operator" for those mentioned above as established by the Kansas Department of Health and Environment.

cc9a437b-ab09-48f4-bdad-5148f050f147.description: The earner of this badge has completed an additional 3 hours of professional development workshop. After completing the workshop the earner will have developed skills with item analysis, test construction and alignment, creation of aligned item sets and improving assessment accessibility.
cc9a437b-ab09-48f4-bdad-5148f050f147.name: Level 2 Assessment Skills In Biology

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: After participating in the workshop, participants will be able to do the following: Utilize learning outcomes to map and create a fair test. Further develop the process of writing selected response questions to assess learning outcomes. Utilize an evaluation checklist to improve accessibility of assessment items. Evaluate test performance to determine the quality of test items and overall test to ensure effectiveness and fairness.

57d36162-88dd-4842-871c-290f926d24eb.description: The earner of this badge have demonstrated advanced skills in assessment design including up to 9 hours of professional development. Earners have demonstrated skills in developing higher order assessment items, writing and critiquing assessment items and converting open ended assessment items to closed response.
57d36162-88dd-4842-871c-290f926d24eb.name: Level 3 Assessment Skills in Biology

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: After participating in the workshop, participants will be able to do the following: Develop higher order assessment items, write and critique assessment items and convert open ended response questions to closed response.

1023bc5e-2850-4558-940f-8d631a31e9f5.description: Student has prepared for the Journeyman or Master Plumber Exam. They have learned how to understand and interpret the current IPC and IFGC, minimum requirements for plumbing materials, installation, & design, how the IPC and IFGC books address regulatory codes for plumbing & mechanical applications, the application process for becoming licensed, OSHA regulations, calculating roof drainage area for a building, water sizing requirements, and drain, waste, & vent requirements for residential homes.
1023bc5e-2850-4558-940f-8d631a31e9f5.name: Plumbing Exam Prep

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must attend the full course and report to JCCC that they have passed the certification exam to receive the badge.

2c3b6914-1369-4a6f-b434-4e9a05a5d8b0.description: In recognition of the long tradition of excellence in community college teaching and leadership, the League established the John & Suanne Roueche Excellence Awards in 2012. Recipients are recognized in a series of activities and promotions, and honored at special events at the League for Innovation in the Community College Innovations conference
2c3b6914-1369-4a6f-b434-4e9a05a5d8b0.name: League for Innovation John and Suanne Roueche Excellence Award

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Be nominated by a colleague.

Be reviewed by a committee of prior recipients based on predetermined criteria. Criteria includes: commitment to the scholarship of teaching and learning; motivate others to learn; respects diverse talents and ways of learning; develops positive relationships; & models leadership through collaboration and support.

4ee05f95-3fc7-4efe-842a-d9176b212ca7.description: This award was established to recognize faculty members, administrators, and administrative staff who epitomize “the importance of excellence in teaching and leadership in open-door settings” by keeping their focus on helping students succeed. These are the individuals who do GREAT things in the classroom, or go out of their way to ensure student learning, success and leadership, and are innovative within the roles they serve on campus.
4ee05f95-3fc7-4efe-842a-d9176b212ca7.name: National Institute for Staff and Organizational Development (NISOD) Award

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Be nominated by a colleague.

Be reviewed by a committee of prior recipients based on predetermined criteria. Criteria includes demonstrate experiences leading to student success; provide outstanding service to the college community; demonstrate consistent leadership/participation in professional development opportunities to enhance area of expertise; engage in innovative approaches to support the strategic initiatives & mission of the college; & demonstrate service to the college that has advanced principles.

73bcf77d-c4ef-42e3-b304-ddb7b3db50d8.description: The student has prepared for the SHRM Certified Professional (SHRM-CP) or SHRM Senior Certified Professional (SHRM-SCP) certification exams. The course material covered includes the SHRM Body of Competency & Knowledge (BoCK) including the People, Organization, Workplace, and Strategy knowledge domains. The new SHRM Certification is designed to ensure that your qualifications meet the ongoing demands of business and prepare you to drive organizational success.
73bcf77d-c4ef-42e3-b304-ddb7b3db50d8.name: SHRM Learning System

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must attend the full course and report to JCCC that they have passed the certification exam to receive the badge.

skills.name: SHRM-CP (Society for Human Resource Management Certified Professional)
SHRM-SCP (Society for Human Resource Management Senior Certified Professional)

54a2294b-bd13-47cd-b974-6e0d1d887174.description: The earner of this badge has completed training to become a more effective leader in the community college organization. They are able to identify and utilize resources to effectively improve the employee experience and drive business results. The earner is well aware of a variety of leadership strategies and models to lead their team and others.
54a2294b-bd13-47cd-b974-6e0d1d887174.name: Living as a Leader

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following courses: The Seven Most Common Mistakes Leaders Make; Be a Great Coach; Communicate by Design; Create a Culture of Employee Engagement; Maximize Performance 365 Days a Year; Support Yourself & Others Through Change; Resolving Workplace Conflict; Create Productive Meetings; Solve Problems, Make Sound Decisions; and Focus Your Team.

de8dcdc8-aa0c-439a-8cb0-2e7c11e8a63a.description: By attending this course, electricians with at least 5 years of working experience in the National Electrical Code have prepared to sit for the Master Electrician licensing exam. They have covered topics including advanced calculations and requirements of the NEC, as well as best practices for passing the examination. Dependent on the location where the student plans to test, different editions of the NEC are used. The 2014 NEC book is utilized for the purpose of instruction.
de8dcdc8-aa0c-439a-8cb0-2e7c11e8a63a.name: Master Electrician Exam Prep

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must attend the full course and report to JCCC that they have passed the certification exam to receive the badge.

30d507f4-2f31-49d8-ad0e-b0a36353d45e.description: The student has prepared for the Journeyman or Masters Licensing Exam. They have learned how to understand and interpret the current International Mechanical Code and International Fuel Gas Code, minimum requirements for mechanical installation & design, how the IMC and IFGC books address regulatory codes for mechanical applications, the application process for becoming a licensed Journeyman or Master Mechanic, heating and cooling loads using a psychrometric chart, and OSHA regulations.
30d507f4-2f31-49d8-ad0e-b0a36353d45e.name: Mechanical / HVAC Exam Prep

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must attend the full course and report to JCCC that they have passed the Journeyman or Masters Licensing Exam to receive the badge.

5df6ad31-5637-4386-bef8-e1598d216851.description: The student has learned all aspects of phlebotomy and specimen collection. They have participated in the didactic and practice lab, where they have learned all aspects of phlebotomy in a healthcare setting, including collection procedures, safety guidelines, patient rights, test requirements, and equipment basics. They have also participated in a 1:1 rotation with clinical laboratory staff to complete the 100+ hour clinical training rotation, a requirement for the national certification test.
5df6ad31-5637-4386-bef8-e1598d216851.name: Phlebotomy Technician Program

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance at all classes is mandatory for the successful completion of this course.

9f9118af-22d6-4947-b66e-e53d83a4f50d.description: This micro-credential provides the learner with an understanding of how to read basic shop drawings. The student will learn the basic layout of drawings, interpret dimensions and specifications, learn and understand weld symbology and notations.
9f9118af-22d6-4947-b66e-e53d83a4f50d.name: Blueprint Reading for Welders Short Course

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Identify Weld Symbols
Determine Dimensions within a drawing set
Determine tolerances with given dimensions

a2a03c99-f0b4-4ac7-8d6c-915c0fd0f4ab.description: This award was established in 1989 in honor of longtime employee Robert Frizzell. The award recognizes the employee who best exemplifies 10+ years of service and helpfulness in their interactions with students, staff, and the community. This award recognizes consistent and long-time attention to the needs of the JCCC community.
a2a03c99-f0b4-4ac7-8d6c-915c0fd0f4ab.name: Bob Frizzell Award

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Be nominated by a JCCC employee for consistent and long term work in serving the JCCC community by providing commitment to the college and the public.

Be reviewed by a committee of college employees based on predetermined criteria. Criteria includes service & helpfulness to students, public, and staff; represent JCCC; & consistent long-time attention.

f2f48440-12a9-49bc-a65b-48cd8355ee88.description: The student has learned how to read & interpret ECGs and differentiate cardiac rhythms. They have participated in didactic & practical training and 3 days of clinical experience working 1:1 with ECG Technician staff in performing ECGs in a variety of hospital units. They have learned cardiac anatomy & physiology, accurately interpreting cardiac rhythms, proper placement of electrodes on the chest, patient confidentiality, professional ethics, infection control & equipment maintenance.
f2f48440-12a9-49bc-a65b-48cd8355ee88.name: ECG Technician Program

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance at all classes and 3 days of clinicals is mandatory for the successful completion of this course.

8d977373-2ff2-4b3e-bbbf-7eb73005d50a.description: The student has learned core processes defined by the Project Management Institute, with emphasis on people skills & real-world practices to successfully manage projects on time, on budget, and within scope. They have taken the following courses: Project Management Essentials, Project Risk Management, Project Quality Management, Effective Communication for Project Managers, Managing Schedules and Costs. Content is aligned with the (PMBOK© Guide), the industry standard for the PM profession.
8d977373-2ff2-4b3e-bbbf-7eb73005d50a.name: Project Management Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete the following required courses to earn the certificate: Project Management Essentials, Project Risk Management, Project Quality Management, Effective Communication for Project Managers, Managing Schedules and Costs

skills.name: Project Management Body Of Knowledge (PMBOK) Methodology

e7ef471f-4127-4f58-9a58-8d27f7b1dd5f.description: This badge is awarded to students who successfully complete one or more portions of the Technology Skills Workshop in the AAC. Students who earn this badge will have a greater understanding of key technology and software used at JCCC.
e7ef471f-4127-4f58-9a58-8d27f7b1dd5f.name: AAC Technology Skills

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must successfully complete the Canvas course with technology modules.

d103e80f-e49c-4cf7-8a83-30272e6b2bb2.description: The student has built a solid foundation with Access. They have received instruction in Access Fundamentals before moving on to more advanced topics in Access Intermediate and Access Advanced. Upon completion of the courses, they are prepared to take the Microsoft Office Specialist exam at our Regnier Testing Center.
d103e80f-e49c-4cf7-8a83-30272e6b2bb2.name: Access Specialist Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete the following required courses within one year to earn the certificate: Access Fundamentals, Access Intermediate, and Access Advanced.

57134556-87df-4196-a838-b0fb5f4c45fb.description: The earner of this badge has completed training to become a more effective educator in the community college classroom. They are able to identify and utilize resources to enhance student learning. The earner is well aware of a variety of instructional strategies to support active learning.
57134556-87df-4196-a838-b0fb5f4c45fb.name: Adjunct Certification Training

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following courses:  Creating a Learner-Centered Syllabus, Legal Issues, Online Learning Tools, Assessment and Curriculum, Microteaching and Classroom Video Recording, Active Learning, Organizational Development Survival Skills, Strategies to Reach Students, Classroom Diversity Issues.  Complete one elective course: Flipping the Classroom, Strengths-Based Classroom, Pedagogy and Classroom Leadership.
Keep a reflective journal indicating how your teaching reflects what you have learned.
Update your Individual Development Plan or Professional Development Portfolio signed by your supervisor.

c5d7b0cc-c804-42c0-9dd8-994cf9fd9409.description: The student has participated in two classroom courses and 480 practicum hours. They have spent time in a nursing facility learning all facets of the Administrator's role and working with all departments of the facility. They have gained knowledge of the long-term care system/network through hands-on experience, understand the role of facility staff, identified key strategies for the challenges of nursing home administration, and administrative duties and responsibilities.
c5d7b0cc-c804-42c0-9dd8-994cf9fd9409.name: Administrator in Training (AIT)

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: The student must attend all classroom and practicum sessions. Upon successful completion of the program students are eligible to apply for the Kansas Adult Care Home Administrator license and to take the open book test over the Kansas Nursing Facility Regulations, the Kansas Assisted Living/Residential Care Facility Regulations, and the 150-question test developed by the National Association of Long Term Care Administrator Boards (NAB).

90234e52-b6ca-4c72-83ea-bcd61d60ee91.description: The student has learned techniques to enhance and editorialize videos to engage viewers, and how to use tools available in Adobe Creative Cloud to edit what they create for social media, distribution, or personal viewing. They have taken the following courses: Premiere Pro - Getting Started, Premiere Pro - Making it Happen, Premiere Pro - Wrapping it Up, After Effects - Getting Started, After Effects - Advanced, Audition Essentials
90234e52-b6ca-4c72-83ea-bcd61d60ee91.name: Adobe Video Editing Specialist Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete the following required courses within one year to earn the certificate: Premiere Pro - Getting Started, Premiere Pro - Making it Happen, Premiere Pro - Wrapping it Up, After Effects - Getting Started, After Effects - Advanced, and Audition Essentials.

225ba6d1-a714-4977-8145-eb0853df0768.description: The student has prepared for both CompTIA A+ exams. They have built a solid IT foundation with A+ Essentials and A+ IT Technician information. They have learned hardware & operating system fundamentals, networking & security, safety & operational procedures, supporting display devices, installing & configuring peripheral components, managing system components & data storage, optimizing & maintaining Windows, customized client environments, networking technologies, security controls, and more.
225ba6d1-a714-4977-8145-eb0853df0768.name: A+ Exam Prep

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must attend the full course and report to JCCC that they have passed both CompTIA A+ exams in order to receive the badge.

103541e1-a118-44f8-b64c-57d816e49754.description: The student has prepared for the PMI Agile Certified Practitioner exam. They have participated in a series of simulations to gain an understanding of the agile process and practice implementing agile practices throughout a project life cycle. They have also learned to lead Agile software projects, and have attended both Agile Project Management Essentials and Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP)© Bootcamp.
103541e1-a118-44f8-b64c-57d816e49754.name: Agile Practitioner Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must attend both Agile Project Management Essentials and Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP)© Bootcamp and report to JCCC that they have passed the PMI Agile Certified Practitioner exam to receive the badge.

d4fd5edd-3098-4c11-8b49-8858c7a1f5cd.description: Student has learned to respond to and manage illnesses and injuries in a child or infant in the first few minutes until professional help arrives. They have covered the Four Steps of Pediatric First Aid and modules in Pediatric First Aid, Child/Infant CPR AED, Adult CPR AED, and Asthma Care Training. Upon successful completion, students will receive a course completion card that is valid for 2 years.The course is designed to meet the regulatory requirements for childcare workers in all 50 states
d4fd5edd-3098-4c11-8b49-8858c7a1f5cd.name: American Heart Association Heartsaver: Pediatric First Aid and CPR

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Both sessions must be taken to receive the certification.

760284f8-95f8-433f-a760-5a998bfa96c1.description: The student has gained an overall understanding of cloud computing concepts, independent of specific technical roles. They have built on that with the fundamentals of building IT infrastructure on AWS, and have taken the following courses: AWS Academy Cloud Foundations (AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner), and AWS Academy Cloud Architecting (AWS Certified Solutions Architect Associate).
760284f8-95f8-433f-a760-5a998bfa96c1.name: AWS Academy Solutions Architect Professional Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete the following required courses to earn the certificate: AWS Academy Cloud Foundations (AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner)and AWS Academy Cloud Architecting (AWS Certified Solutions Architect Associate).

a6c44545-e427-4afb-99b6-ee09756e21f5.description: This award was established in 1989 in honor of longtime employee Robert Frizzell. The award recognizes individuals who exemplify the college's values: student-centered, teaching and learning, community engagement, innovation, belonging, and integrity.
a6c44545-e427-4afb-99b6-ee09756e21f5.name: Bob Frizzell Cavalier Award

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Be nominated by a JCCC employee for consistently showing at least three of the college's values in your day-to-day contributions.
Be reviewed by a committee of college employees based on predetermined criteria.

c1626ec0-d6ab-43a9-a542-2efcd66bb32e.description: The student has gained skills to make better business decisions resulting in increased profits and opportunities. They have learned to better understand basic financial information and how to use that information to make confident decisions that will positively impact the bottom line. They have covered topics including Accounting Basics, Analyzing Financial Statements, Budgeting Fundamentals, and Cost Accounting.
c1626ec0-d6ab-43a9-a542-2efcd66bb32e.name: Business Accounting Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete the following classes within 1 year to earn the certificate: Accounting Basics, Analyzing Financial Statements, Budgeting Fundamentals, and Cost Accounting.

1cac4e9a-8fb9-4e0a-8297-802bbf430e04.description: The student has learned the skills and gained the confidence to effectively convey professionalism with their words and actions. They have improved their written, spoken, and interpersonal communication skills by taking the following courses: Building a Team Even if You Aren't the Leader, Speaking & Presenting for Business Meetings, Writing for Business Results, Editing, Revising & Polishing Business Writing, Grammar, Punctuation & Proofreading Tips, Speaking to Influence Decisions and Actions.
1cac4e9a-8fb9-4e0a-8297-802bbf430e04.name: Business Communication Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete the following classes within 1 year to earn the certificate: Building a Team Even if You Aren't the Leader, Speaking & Presenting for Business Meetings, Writing for Business Results, Editing, Revising & Polishing Business Writing, Grammar, Punctuation & Proofreading Tips, Speaking to Influence Decisions and Actions

68893f9c-b581-4c95-b70b-66514c0a1207.description: The student has learned to think strategically, assess financial implications of decisions, mobilize change within organizations, & communicate with business leaders. They've gained an understanding of leadership & strategic management concepts to contribute to organizational performance. Course topics include Communication, Building & Sustaining Trust, Coaching: Move People Forward, Delegation: Engage & Empower People, Developing Yourself & Others, Driving Change, Resolving Workplace Conflict.
68893f9c-b581-4c95-b70b-66514c0a1207.name: Business Leadership Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete the following classes within 1 year to earn the certificate: Communication: Connect Through Conversations, Building and Sustaining Trust, Coaching: Move People Forward, Delegation: Engage and Empower People, Developing Yourself and Others, Driving Change, Resolving Workplace Conflict

5316e67d-f40c-42bc-82d6-475fb2c2932f.description: The student has prepared for the Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP) certification exam. They have gained deep knowledge and competency from hands-on experience with cyber, information, software, and cloud computing infrastructure security and have reviewed the 6 CCSP domains of the common body of knowledge which cover Architectural Concepts & Design Requirements, Cloud Data Security, Cloud Platform & Infrastructure Security, Cloud Application Security, Operations, Legal & Compliance.
5316e67d-f40c-42bc-82d6-475fb2c2932f.name: Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP) Bootcamp

f9ffbb3e-8962-4d7b-a3aa-d97ad1dc2f90.description: The student has prepared for the Certified CMMC Professional (CCP) certification exam. 7155d1ba-cafa-48a6-8afa-9db67d409f6b.description: The student has prepared for the Certified Hacking Forensic Investigator (CHFI) exam. They have learned to use today’s tools in the forensic trade, including software, hardware and specialized techniques used in computer hacking forensic investigation or in the process of detecting hacking attacks and properly extracting evidence to report the crime and conduct audits to prevent future attacks. They have studied digital evidence acquisition, handling & analysis in a forensically sound manner.
7155d1ba-cafa-48a6-8afa-9db67d409f6b.name: Certified Hacking Forensic Investigator (CHFI) Bootcamp

badge_template_activities.title: Students must attend the full course and report to JCCC that they have passed the Certified Hacking Forensic Investigator (CHFI) exam to receive the badge.

They have learned information security governance, legal & regulatory issues, common insurance policies & imposed conditions, process improvement, recovery time objectives for information resources, security metrics, risk management, and more.
107a8c6e-3fff-47b8-913f-06c33aea7f8f.name: Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) Bootcamp

98973ead-063f-4412-bebd-891750c7af46.description: The student has prepared for the Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) certification exam, world-renowned as the standard of achievement for those who audit, control, monitor, & assess an organization's IT & business systems. 98973ead-063f-4412-bebd-891750c7af46.name: Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) Bootcamp

e26391b5-6908-4acb-80d5-563105993275.description: The student has prepared for the Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) certification exam, recognized as an objective measure of competence & achievement for information security professionals. They have learned the 8 domains of the information security practice or common body of knowledge, including security models, distributed access control methods, DBMS architectures, key cryptography algorithms, intrusion detection systems, data network components & technologies.
e26391b5-6908-4acb-80d5-563105993275.name: Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) Bootcamp

badge_template_activities.title: Students must attend the full course and report to JCCC that they have passed the Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) certification exam in order to receive the badge.

93e6d08b-dc33-4c75-885d-5ca60152d518.description: The student has prepared for the CRISC (Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control) certification exam. They have learned the unique challenges of IT and enterprise risk management, and are positioned to become strategic partners to the enterprise. They have studied and understand the 4 Domains: Domain 1: IT Risk Identification, Domain 2: IT Risk Assessment, Domain 3: Risk Response Mitigation, and Domain 4: Risk and Control Monitoring and Reporting.

badge_template_activities.title: Students must attend the full course and report to JCCC that they have passed the CRISC (Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control) certification exam to receive the badge.

8e4d9e26-2527-40ac-85d0-e4f669bc2a4a.description: The student has learned the fundamentals of Scrum, including product backlog, sprint backlog, daily Scrum meetings, sprint planning meetings, and burn charts. They have learned to help project teams properly use Scrum, increasing the likelihood of a project's overall success. They understand Scrum values, practices, and applications, as well as how to protect teams from both internal & external distractions. They provide a level of knowledge & expertise beyond that of typical project managers.

3cf9fb16-012f-4f3c-8731-1b2f4a9d9f66.description: The student has used core Azure services to gain an overall understanding of cloud computing concepts, independent of specific technical roles, and understands Google Cloud computing for storage and other services. ccc2c6ec-f26a-4bb0-b011-35308d1cd182.description: The student has prepared for the CompTIA Advanced Security Practitioner certification exam, an international, vendor-neutral exam that proves competency in risk management; enterprise security operations and architecture; research and collaboration; and integration of enterprise security. The Cloud+ certification validates knowledge and best practices required of IT practitioners working in cloud computing environments, who must understand and deliver cloud infrastructure. The student has reviewed all areas of the Cloud+ certification exam including Cloud Computing concepts, models & terminology. In addition, the application and testing process as well as key test topics and practice questions are covered.
42bff99c-7fc9-42fe-86a2-673f16d8c960.name: CompTIA Cloud+ Bootcamp

5dab2187-125a-4789-8695-8df48e2e1013.description: Student has prepared for the CySA+ exam. They have reviewed domains covered by CySA+ including Threat & Vulnerability Management, Software & Systems Security, Security & Operations & Monitoring, Incident Response, Compliance & Assessment. Passing the exam certifies they have the knowledge & skills required to perform data analysis & interpret results to identify vulnerabilities, threats, and risks to an organization, configure & use threat detection tools, secure & protect applications & systems
5dab2187-125a-4789-8695-8df48e2e1013.name: CompTIA Cybersecurity Analyst (CySA+) Bootcamp

cf9f2eaf-52ad-4ca4-b22b-b75d8eb2208a.description: The student has prepared for the CompTIA PenTest+ Exam. They have been introduced to concepts & methodologies related to pen testing, and have worked through a simulated test for a fictitious company. They have covered planning & scoping pen tests, conducting passive & active reconnaissance, performing non-technical tests, analyzing vulnerabilities, penetrating networks, exploiting host-based vulnerabilities, testing applications, completing post-exploit tasks, analyzing & reporting test results
cf9f2eaf-52ad-4ca4-b22b-b75d8eb2208a.name: CompTIA PenTest+® Bootcamp

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must attend the full course and report to JCCC that they have passed the CompTIA PenTest+ Exam to receive the badge.

04eb6a03-5ec5-4584-be20-09fe1c4b415c.description: The student has reviewed topics and prepared for the CompTIA Security+ Exam. The exam validates knowledge and understanding of foundation-level security standards. It is an international vendor-neutral security certification widely used to demonstrate both compliance & competence in the security industry. The student has reviewed all areas of the Security+ exam including systems security, network infrastructure, access control, assessments & audits, cryptography & organizational security.
04eb6a03-5ec5-4584-be20-09fe1c4b415c.name: CompTIA Security+ Bootcamp

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must attend the full course and report to JCCC that they have passed the CompTIA Security+ Exam to receive the badge.

c59b0a64-497e-495b-bd1d-79e338d82ae7.description: By earning this certificate, students will prepare and guard against the invisible threats to software, hardware and data. They have learned about Information Security Essentials, Security Architecture and Design, and Security+ Exam Prep.

By attending this course, the student has reviewed topics and prepared for the Certified Ethical Hacker exam. They have learned the standards & language involved in attempting to penetrate a network or computer system, studied security risks using lectures and in-class exercises, and covered topics including hacking, penetration testing, scanning networks, footprinting & reconnaissance, viruses, and more.

718a9116-1152-4fd7-af17-9da5f344c247.description: The student has been introduced to key aspects of leadership, including communication, teamwork (including virtual and hybrid teamwork), coaching, goal setting, and unconscious bias. They have gained an understanding and appreciation of important topics in leadership, and have taken the following required courses: Communicating For Results, Principles of Leadership, Essentials of Teamwork, Coaching through Goal Setting and Feedback, and Unconscious Bias in the Workplace.

f28b3301-449e-4dce-9cdf-8dc5d9d0152d.description: The Full Stack Web Development certificate emphasizes programming with markup and scripting languages for the web. The student has started their Full Stack Web Development journey learning a foundation of web concepts. They have built their coding skills in HTML5 and CSS3, and gained the foundational skills of programming before moving into more specific web development-based programming technologies. They have participated in hands-on courses to increase their aptitude for programming.

935b328a-5652-4983-bc92-6962608f89a4.description: The student has prepared for the General Educational Development (GED®) test. They have learned basic skills in reading, writing, and math, work readiness, and computer literacy skills.

f5c8a352-cf7c-4018-a8a1-ebd8ef1a9eba.description: The student will be prepared for the Implementing and Administering Cisco Networking Technologies exam. The instructor-led, student-involved discussion and hands-on labs cover a broad range of topics including network fundamentals, network access, IP connectivity, IP services, security fundamentals, and automation and programmability. Students will learn an introduction to networking, implementing ethernet LANs, implementing VLANs and STP, IPv4 Addressing, IPv4 Routing, OSPF, and Wireless LANs.
f5c8a352-cf7c-4018-a8a1-ebd8ef1a9eba.name: Implementing and Administering Cisco Networking Technologies (CCNA) Exam Prep

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must attend the full course and report to JCCC that they have passed the Implementing and Administering Cisco Networking Technologies exam to receive the badge.

b6350da6-c117-4287-a5c7-5ee2a7d5b9cd.description: This micro-credential will expose learners to the most popular welding and metal cutting/prep processes used today. The student will learn how to work safely using welding equipment and materials, how to use tools of the trade and practice basic cutting and welding techniques.
b6350da6-c117-4287-a5c7-5ee2a7d5b9cd.name: Intro to Welding Short Course

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Safety Test for Welding
Applied metal cutting skills using Oxy-Acetylene and Plasma-Arc methods
Demonstrated basic understanding and skill in SMAW (Shielded Metal Arc Welding)
Demonstrated basic understanding and skill in GMAW (Gas Metal Arc Welding)

4b6bbfbb-9d32-42db-ad12-34e81813ad35.description: The 10-month interactive institute is a leadership development initiative designed to help aspiring community college leaders hone their leadership skills for application in their current positions and/or to take the next steps in their careers. Additionally, it facilitates a broader understanding of higher education in general and the community college sector in particular.
4b6bbfbb-9d32-42db-ad12-34e81813ad35.name: Kansas Community College Leadership Institute (KCCLI) Badge

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Pertinent higher education topics: universal community college mission; higher education in Kansas community college funding and effective resource management; happiness in the workplace; legislature landscape; getting the right people on the bus in the right seats; HR do's and don'ts; higher ed accreditation; media relations; Title IX; and athletics.

Assessment and analysis via Strengths-based Leadership text and tool; development; implementation and presentation of an approved leadership project; development and application of a written personal mission statement; development and application of a written leadership philosophy; interaction with current KCCLI classmates and alumni; development and application of a values-based personal leadership brand; development of a portfolio that includes updated cover letter; resume and why board.

One-on-one Interviews with the following: Community college president and chair of board of trustees; chief financial officer and foundation director; human resources director; and Title IX coordinator.
Required texts: Strengths Based Leadership; Good to Great; Thirteen Ideas That Are Transforming the Community College World; The Five Dysfunctions of a Team; and current relevant articles.

1e8e7c44-5f20-43d6-a6e2-649923490cb5.description: An earner is recognized with this badge after attending all sessions within a GAME Series (each series has 4-5 sessions). Sessions are designed to help growing companies gain focus, set a growth agenda, make decisions and take action. Each series is led by subject matter experts providing content and continuity throughout all sessions.
1e8e7c44-5f20-43d6-a6e2-649923490cb5.name: Kansas SBDC GAME

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Attend all sessions within a GAME Series

ab8f7557-80b8-4e7b-8cf1-93379e86d53f.description: The student has prepared for the CKA (Certified Kubernetes Administrator) exam. They have learned installation, application lifecycle management, networking, storage, security, scheduling, logging, maintenance, and troubleshooting of Kubernetes.

e847ac67-20fb-42ec-a6d2-bf6920fb8807.description: The student has prepared for the Lean Six Sigma Black Belt certification exam. They have learned Six Sigma philosophies & principles, including supporting systems & tools. They have demonstrated team leadership, understand team dynamics & can assign team member roles & responsibilities. They have a thorough understanding of all aspects of the DMAIC model in accordance with Six Sigma principles, and knowledge of Lean enterprise concepts to identify non-value-added elements & activities.
e847ac67-20fb-42ec-a6d2-bf6920fb8807.name: Lean Six Sigma Black Belt

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete the classroom curriculum, participate in a real-world project, and report to JCCC that they have achieved a minimum 80% exam score in order to receive the badge.

6faa2af4-d590-4287-af3d-957832392bb8.description: The student has learned Lean Six Sigma concepts, including Lean Operations, Project Management, Team Development & Management, and Design. They have covered the Define Phase, Improve Phase, and Control Phase. They have learned to identify key measures, establish performance baselines, collect & analyze data, search for improvement opportunities, generate & test possible solutions, design implementation tests, document & implement identified tools, create and deploy response plans, and more.
6faa2af4-d590-4287-af3d-957832392bb8.name: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Certification

1913d0c9-0207-4c84-ba0b-4ee8d74d7803.description: The course subject matter is mapped to CompTIA Network+ exam objectives. They have learned the fundamental building blocks to form a modern network, such as protocols, topologies, hardware, and network operating systems. They have also explored the following concepts: TCP/IP, Ethernet, wireless transmission, and security.

8e1bac4b-d88a-447c-8b64-5f3e132d5304.description: The earner is recognized for an outstanding effort or major achievement in one of the four areas of the strategic plan: Student Success; Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion; Community Partnerships; & Employee Engagement. The earner has positively impacted the college, department, or community through either: accomplishing a special project; chairing a task force; implementing excellent systems for accomplishing work in a department; being an outstanding contributor to the success of the college.
8e1bac4b-d88a-447c-8b64-5f3e132d5304.name: Outstanding Employee Award

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: An earner must be nominated by supervisor or with their supervisor's support.

Be reviewed by a committee of employees based on predetermined criteria. Criteria includes customer focus; potential impact; innovation/entreprenuership; above and beyond scope of normal job duties; & collaboration/community.

1f66fc65-37da-4674-9d33-1f833d1dedc4.description: The student has prepared for the Project Management Professional (PMP)® Certification Exam. 419bb221-ae7d-434d-827c-d5d4c2818230.description: The student has built a solid foundation in PowerPoint. They have received instruction in PowerPoint Fundamentals before moving on to more advanced topics in PowerPoint Intermediate and PowerPoint Advanced. Upon completion of the courses, they are prepared to take the Microsoft Office Specialist exam at our Regnier Testing Center.
419bb221-ae7d-434d-827c-d5d4c2818230.name: PowerPoint Specialist Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete the following required courses within one year to earn the certificate: PowerPoint Fundamentals, PowerPoint Intermediate, and PowerPoint Advanced.

4b2f8511-1211-415d-8391-b3a1bd205315.description: The student has learned how to use Python Programming to code in an efficient, flexible, and effective way. They have covered topics such as code readability, syntax, expressions, GUIs, CGI programming, and more. They have taken the following required courses: Introduction to Python Programming, Advanced Python Programming, and Python Programming for Data Analysis.
4b2f8511-1211-415d-8391-b3a1bd205315.name: Python Programming Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete the following required courses within one year to earn the certificate: Introduction to Python Programming, Advanced Python Programming, and Python Programming for Data Analysis.

d6a4043b-65b8-4455-a35a-7eb9d5d3cc8f.description: The student has prepared for the Salesforce Administrator Certification exam. They have learned how to oversee the day-to-day functions of a company as it relates to Salesforce software. They have covered topics including configuration & setup, security controls, data management & sharing, customization, sales & marketing applications, service & support applications, case management, Salesforce Mobile App, lead management & campaign tools, reporting, workflow & process automation, and more.
d6a4043b-65b8-4455-a35a-7eb9d5d3cc8f.name: Salesforce Administrator – Your Foundation for Certification

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must attend the full course and report to JCCC that they have passed the Salesforce Administrator Certification exam to receive the certification.

8ffaf706-dfca-4cf2-87e0-b45bc8ef0439.description: The student has prepared for the Security+ Exam which validates knowledge and understanding of foundation-level security standards and is an international vendor-neutral security certification widely used to demonstrate both compliance and competence in the security industry.They have reviewed systems security, network infrastructure, access control, assessments & audits, cryptography & organizational security, the application & testing process, as well as key test topics and practice questions.
8ffaf706-dfca-4cf2-87e0-b45bc8ef0439.name: Security+ Exam Prep

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must attend the full course and report to JCCC that they have passed the Security+ Exam to receive the badge.

0a625126-1ab4-4b2a-bedd-96d9ed517b97.description: The student has learned the foundation for Microsoft SQL Server, one of the most popular relational database management systems, including SQL, T-SQL, application development, integration & reporting services. They have learned how to define, build and deploy relational databases using SQL Server and how to create and implement advanced reporting solutions.
0a625126-1ab4-4b2a-bedd-96d9ed517b97.name: SQL Server Developer Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students must complete the following required courses within one year to earn the certificate: Introduction to SQL Server, SQL Server Transact-SQL (T-SQL) Programming, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).

448dd47b-50c4-4006-a7f0-0691900feb50.description: The student has learned about new and evolving challenges in the workplace, including how to manage and work with multi-generational workforces, hybrid workforces, business ethics, managing time, and the pressures of the workplace. They have gained an understanding and appreciation of the changing workplace and workforce, and have taken the following required courses: Unconscious Bias in the Workplace, Bridging Generations, Hybrid Workforces, Business Ethics, Managing Time & Workplace Pressures.
448dd47b-50c4-4006-a7f0-0691900feb50.name: Today's Challenges in Leadership Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: The student must complete the following required courses to earn the certificate: Unconscious Bias in the Workplace, Bridging Generations, Hybrid Workforces, Business Ethics, Managing Time and Workplace Pressures

e733af05-8fdc-4c4f-a356-9572d3a5a509.description: The student has built a solid foundation in Word. They have received instruction in Word Fundamentals and Word Intermediate before moving on to Word Advanced. Upon completion of the courses, they are prepared to take the Microsoft Office Specialist exam at the JCCC Regnier Testing Center.
e733af05-8fdc-4c4f-a356-9572d3a5a509.name: Word Specialist Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Johnson County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Students will need to complete the following required courses within one year to earn the certificate: Word Fundamentals, Word Intermediate, and Word Advanced.
